question.text: Identify the incorrect statement from the following:

options.text: Zirconium and Hafnium have identical radii of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>160</mn><mi>pm</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>159</mn><mi>pm</mi><mo>,</mo></math> respectively as a consequence of lanthanoid contraction.

The lanthanoid ions other than the <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">f</mi><mn>0</mn></msup></math> type and the <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">f</mi><mn>14</mn></msup></math> type are all paramagnetic.

The overall decrease in atomic and ionic radii
from lanthanum to lutetium is called lanthanoid 
contraction.

solution.text: lanthanoid shows general oxidation state <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math> but some elements can shows <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></math> as well as <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>.</mo></math> So the given option is wrong.
